intro: Ranunculus jucundus, commonly known as the cheerful buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features delicate, palmate leaves and bright yellow flowers with a distinctive central pistil. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and blooms from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens but is considered rare in the wild.
